page.title: 19TOURISM _ BORTH
page.content: Since Thomas Savin brought the railway and the first tourists to Borth in 1863, tourism has prospered and the locals learned to cater for them. The first hotel built by Savin was soon followed by others, and there are now The Cliff, The Golf, The Grand and The Railway Hotels in Borth. Many people also provide bed and breakfast accomodation, there is a Youth Hostel, and there are various static and touring caravan and camping sites _ Brynowen, Brynrodyn, Glanlery, Golden Sands and Ysfron. Numerous houses, cottages and flats are let for holidays during the summer months. Local walks, craft shops, clubs and activities at the caravan sites and in the community, swimming pools, amusement arcades and donkey rides help to cater for the entertainment of the visitors.
